alert.note: Alert for Rosebud; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 7:26PM MDT until June 16 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Forsyth affecting Treasure and Rosebud Counties. Yellowstone River at Miles City affecting Custer County. .Exceptional water levels on the upper reaches of the Yellowstone River will couple with other smaller rivers in the region to cause significant rises over the next 48 to 72 hours. The Yellowstone River is forecast to crest at 11.9 feet at Forsyth, which is 2.1 feet below flood stage of 14 feet. The Yellowstone River is forecast to crest at 13.8 feet at Miles City, which is near flood stage of 14 feet. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Forsyth. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water begins to seep up from the ground into basements of homes along the west side of Forsyth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Monday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Yellowstone River Forsyth 14.0 8.9 Mon 6 pm 10.3 11.9 9.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 130 PM MDT.
